description: The IP_RES_TYPEEPISODE table contains information about the restraint type episodes within a restraint episode. A restraint type episode is defined as the period during which a patient has a single type of restraint applied. The information includes start/end dates, length, and starting department.

columns.name: RES_TYPE
columns.description: The restraint type can be a behavioral restraint (BH) or  nonbehavioral/medical-surgical restraint (MS).

columns.name: INPATIENT_DATA_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the inpatient data store record.

columns.name: EPISODE_NUM
columns.description: The EPISODE_NUM refers to the episode number for the admission.  The episode number assigned to an episode increases with each new episode and does not repeat until a new admission.  An episode is the length of a restraint order.  A value of '0' here represents that there were errors for the corresponding restraint type in the current inpatient data record.

columns.name: RES_ROW_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the flowsheet row record for the type of restraint used.

columns.name: RES_ROW_ID_DISP_NAME
columns.description: The display name given to the flowsheet group/row.

columns.name: TYPE_START_DT
columns.description: The type episode start date refers to the instant for which the flowsheet row for that restraint type had a START documented.

columns.name: TYPE_END_DT
columns.description: The type episode end date refers to the instant for which the flowsheet row for that restraint type had a DISCONTINUED documented.

columns.name: TYPE_DEPT_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the department where the restraint type episode began.

columns.name: TYPE_LENGTH
columns.description: The length of time in hours that the restraint documentation indicates that the restraint type has been on for.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: This column contains a number to uniquely identify different restraint type episodes that have the same episode and restraint row ID.
